questions.question: Which of the following best describes the services covered under UNICEF's GOBI-FFF strategy?

options.A: Providing emergency relief and disaster response
options.B: Promoting environmental sustainability and climate action
options.C: Enhancing maternal health and prenatal care

questions.explanation: child health interventions in resource-limited settings. UNICEF- United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund Headquarters - New York Established in 1946 GOBI-FFF campaign: G rowth monitoring O ral rehydration solution B reastfeeding I mmunisation F emale Literacy F amily Planning F ood Supplements Services provided: Child health Child nutrition: Making high-protein and low-cost food mixes Aids Applied nutrition programme by FAO Family and Child Welfare Education

questions.question: Which international organization primarily focuses on reproductive health and population issues?
questions.explanation: focusing on reproductive health and population issues. United Nations Fund for Population Activity (UNFPA): Headquarters - New York Established in 1967 Addresses population and development issues Develops national capability for the manufacture of contraceptives Food and Agricultural Organisation (FAO) (Option A): Headquarters - Rome. It has taken the initiative for 3 F's: Farming, Forestry, Fisheries Objective - Increase production of food to keep pace with the growing world population World Food Programme (WFP) (Option B): World's largest international food organisation Beneficiaries: Poor women and children at risk, poor first dependent population. WFP developed India-mix—40% maize, 40% wheat, and 20% full-fat soya bean fortified with micronutrients (iron, calcium, vitamin A)—which was distributed through the ICDS project. Urban Health Equity Assessment and Response Tool (Urban HEART) (Option D): Urban HEART is a tool developed by WHO that is designed to address health inequities in urban areas. It helps policymakers identify disparities, assess their causes, and implement strategies to improve health outcomes for disadvantaged populations. Reference: Park’s Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine, 27th Edition, Page 1030 https://www.wfp.org/storie s/wfp-glance#:~:text=We%20provide%20access%20to%20healthy,between%20January%20and%20September%20 2023 . https://wcd.nic.in/integrated-child-development-services-icds-scheme

questions.question: Which of the following is not a bilateral agency?
questions.explanation: by 3 or more countries to work on issues. Examples include the UN, WHO, World Bank, and the International Monetary Fund. World Bank Headquarters - Washington . Objective - Help less developed countries to raise living standards by lending money (Bank for countries) Bilateral agencies: Formed between 2 countries, provides funds to developing countries Agencies Headquarters Services in India Option A: United States Agency for International Development (USAID) Washington Malaria eradication Medical and nursing education Health education Water supply and sanitation Nutrition and Family Planning Control of Communicable Diseases Option C: Swedish International Development Agency (SIDA) Sweden Assisting the National TB Control Program Option D: Danish International Development Agency (DANIDA) Denmark Assisting the National Blindness Control Programme Image 2- SIDA Image 3- DANIDA Reference: Park’s Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine, 27th Edition, Page1030-1 https://www.jstor.org/stable/resrep26672.5 https://dea.gov.in/multilateral-institutions-divisions https://www.adb.org/about/multilateral-organizations

questions.question: Which organisation promotes economic and social development in South Asia and the South-East Asia region?
questions.explanation: of collective intergovernmental for economic and social development in South and Southeast Asia. Primary focus is on agricultural and industrial development and sometimes on health. Membership - 20 developing countries. 6 non-regional members - Australia, Canada, Japan, New Zealand, UK, USA. Provides Cobalt Radiotherapy Units to Medical Colleges AIIMS in New Delhi was established with financial assistance from New Zealand. Rockefeller Foundation (NGO) Headquarters - New York. Work in India began in 1920 with a scheme for control of hookworm disease in Madras presidency. Established All India Institute of Hygiene and Public Health at Kolkata Sponsoring visits of medical specialists from the USA. Grants-in-aid to select institutions for research and development. Assistance to research projects and institutions Ford Foundation (NGO) Headquarters - New York. Active in the development of rural health services and family planning. Ford Foundation has helped India with the following projects: Rural Health and Rural environment and sanitation Establishment of the National Institute of Health Administration and Education (NIHAE) at Delhi Kolkata water supply and drainage scheme Supporting research in reproductive biology and family planning fellowship programs CARE- Cooperative for assistance and Relief Everywhere (NGO) Headquarters - Geneva. Provides emergency aid and long-term development assistance In India: Integrated Nutrition and Health Project Improving Women's Health Project Anaemia Control Project Improved Health Care for Adolescent Girls Project Child Survival Project Family Spacing Project Konkan Integrated Development Project

questions.question: Which of the following organisations has its headquarters in Geneva?
questions.explanation: other organizations’ headquarters are in New York. Headquarters of various health organizations New York (All the organisations starting with UN except UNAID) UN UNDP UNFPA UNICEF Rockefeller Foundation FORD Foundation Geneva UNAID (Exception) I WHO International Labour Organization International Red Cross I CARE Washington World Bank USAID The Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) Rome FAO Note : Headquarters of UNESCO (doesn’t deal with health)- Paris Reference: Park’s Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine, 27th Edition, Page1025,1029,1028,1030,1032 https://www.rockefellerfoundation.org/about-us/offices/ https://www.fordfoundation.org/about/the-ford-foundation-center-for-social-justice/visitor-information/ https://www.unaids.org/en/aboutunaids/contactunaids https://www.worldbank.org/en/about/contacts https://www.unfpa.org/contact https://www.undp.org/about-us/faqs#:~:text=the%20United%20Nations%20.-,Where %20is%20UNDP%20located%3F,available%20on%20our%20home%20page.&text=When%20and%20how%20di d%20UNDP%20come%20into%20being%3F,-UNDP%20is%20based

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) adopted by the United Nations in 2015?

options.A: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
options.B: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education for all
options.C: Promote sustainable consumption and production patterns

questions.explanation: Correct answer: D) Achieve world peace and disarmament Explanation: Achieving world peace and disarmament is not one of the specific Sustainable Development Goals adopted by the United Nations. The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), adopted by the United Nations and UNDP in 2015, aim to eradicate poverty, ensure prosperity, and protect the planet by 2030. There are 17 goals: 1. End poverty everywhere in all its forms. (Option A) 2. Zero hunger- Achieve food security, improve nutrition, and promote sustainable agriculture. 3. Ensure healthy lives and well-being for all ages. 4. Provide inclusive and equitable quality education and lifelong learning opportunities. (Option B) 5. Achieve gender equality and empower women and girls. 6. Ensure access to sustainable & clean water and sanitation for all. 7. Ensure access to affordable, clean and modern energy for all. 8. Promote sustainable economic growth, full employment, and decent work. 9. Build resilient infrastructure, promote sustainable industrialization, and foster innovation. 10. Reduce inequality within and among countries. 11. Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient, and sustainable 12. Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns. (Option C) 13. Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts. 14. Conserve and sustainably use water bodies - oceans, seas, and marine resources. 15. Protect, restore, and sustainably use terrestrial ecosystems and preserve biodiversity. 16. Promote peaceful and inclusive societies, ensure access to justice, and build effective institutions. 17. Strengthen global partnerships for sustainable development. Reference: https://www.undp.org/sustainable-development-goals https://www.undp.org/turkiye/projects/sustainable-development-goals-investment-initiative
